# Debugging a function

The code below is supposed to calculate the first x Fibonacci numbers, and to plot them in a Fibonacci spiral.  Unfortunately it still contains an error and doesnâ€™t work. 
Use the R debugger to find and fix the problem.

```{r}
library("shape")
plot_fib <- function(x){
  plot(-max(x):max(x),
       -max(x):max(x),
       type="n",xlab="",ylab="",main="Fibonacchi spiral") #empty plot
  #x-coordinate for the center of the circle
  # (?, x axis_right , ?, ?)
  x.coor <- c(0,0,cumsum(x*rep(c(1,0,-1,0),length=length(x)))) 
  #y-coordinate for the center of the circle
  # (?, y axis_up after 2nd , axis up after 3rd, ?)
  phi <- (1+ sqrt(5))/2
  y.coor <- c(0,0,cumsum(x*rep(c(0, phi, 0, -phi),length=length(x)))) 
  a1 <- 0:length(x)*pi/2 #angle start
  a2 <- 1:(length(x)+1)*pi/2 #angle end 
  for (i in 1:length(x)){
    #plot the quartercircles
    plotcircle(r = x[i], mid = c(x.coor[i],y.coor[i]), 
               from = a1[i], to = a2[i]) 
  }
}
a <- c(1,0,-1,0)
rep(a)*2
fibonacci <- function(n) { #function to generate Fibonacci numbers
  if (is.nan(n)){
    return("n can't be NAN")
    break
  }
  if (n==1) {
    x <- 0
  } else {
    x <- c(0,1)
    while (length(x) < n) {
      position <- length(x)
      new <- x[position] + x[position-1]
      x <- c(x,new)
    }
  }
  plot_fib(x)
  return(x)
}
fibonacci(10)
fibonacci(log(-1))
```
